title: FOI for Food Safety Data - Taco Mex Mexican Street Chef

content:
Thursday 16th May, 2024.
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information request regarding health information for a business situated in Sheffield.
Specifically, I would like to see:
•	Reports relating to food safety inspections/food hygiene ratings,
•	Any relevant correspondence or emails around the above,
•	Please supply the information regarding the most recent inspection and any reports/documentation relating to other inspections during the three previous years.
The business I am enquiring about is:
Taco Mex Mexican Street Chef
84 London Road
Sheffield
S2 4LR
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within 20 working days, i.e. by Thursday 13th June 2024.
Yours sincerely,
M Cocker (Ms)

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Taco Mex Mexican
Street Chef which we received on 16/05/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 14/06/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Taco Mex Mexican
Street Chef which we received on 16/05/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
• the number of people in your LA currently in council tax arrears.
106,386 Council Tax accounts have a balance from a previous year
• the number of people in council tax arrears in your LA May 2022/2023.
We do not hold this information
• the number of people in council tax arrears in your LA 2018/2019.
We do not hold this information
• The number of liability orders made in 2023/24 in your LA.
34,361
• The number of liability orders made in 2022/23 in your LA.
33,247
• The number of liability orders made in 2021/22 in your LA.
24,621
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Taco Mex Mexican
Street Chef which we received on 16/05/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Please see attached.
The names of third parties and the names of some staff members have been
redacted under Regulation 12(3) of the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13 EIR as amended by Sch. 19, para
307 of the Data Protection Act 2018, which provide an exception for where
the information requested includes personal data of which the applicant is
not the data subject where disclosure would contravene the data protection
principles of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of
the information would contravene the data protection principle under
Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation that processing
of personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
Please note that there was an error, and the wrong hygiene rating was
awarded at the time of inspection. This has now been rectified – the
inspecting officer revisited on 24/05/2024 to notify the business of the
error and to exchange their Food Hygiene Rating window sticker from a 5
rating to 4 rating.  So, the initial inspection report issued at the time
of inspection will show an incorrect hygiene rating – this was not
available at the time of revisit for the inspecting officer to amend.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
Thank you for your response to my FOI request.
Can you please confirm that you have provided copies of everything that was requested? For clarity, I requested:
_____________________
Specifically, I would like to see:
• Reports relating to food safety inspections/food hygiene ratings,
• Any relevant correspondence or emails around the above,
• Please supply the information regarding the most recent inspection and any reports/documentation relating to other inspections during the three previous years.
______________________
Please either confirm that this handwritten two-page document is the only piece of correspondence / document / email / letter in the period 13/03/2021 - 13/03/2024, or supply the documentation that was omitted in your reply.
Yours sincerely,
M Cocker

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please pass this on to the person who conducts Freedom of Information reviews.
I am writing to request an internal review of Sheffield City Council's handling of my FOI request 'FOI for Food Safety Data - Taco Mex Mexican Street Chef'.
I do not believe I have had a full response to this request.
A full history of my FOI request and all correspondence is available on the Internet at this address:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/f...
Yours faithfully,
M Cocker

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to Taco
Mex Mexican Street Chef which we received on 21/06/2024. We are sorry to
hear that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Code of Practice – Environmental Information Regulations 2004 states
that we must respond to your request for internal review within 40 working
days, by 20/08/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email
address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear M Cocker
Apologies for the delayed reply to your query.
The report sent is correct.  There have been no other food hygiene visits,
correspondence or emails within the dates specified relating to food
hygiene inspections.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
